results.title: Sprints
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Coaching and Training for Track and Field Events”.
Gives coaching tips for sprints events from Olympic athletes and coaches, plus footage of sprints events from the Moscow Olympics.

results.title: Beyond LSD: a film for concerned adults and teenagers
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford, Film Associates and Paul Burnford Film Productions

video_links.name: Beyond LSD: a film for concerned adults and teenagers

results.brief_description: This 1960’s film is about the communication gap between two generations: teenagers and young adults on the one hand, and the generation of those over thirty - “the establishment”. The teenagers’ use of LSD and other drugs is only one of the symptoms of this communication gap. A group of parents desperately seek help in order to understand what has gone wrong. The film is an attempt to go “beyond LSD” and is intended to stimulate discussion amongst high school students, college students, teachers and parents. Ample involuntary hilarity can result from viewing this great hysterical/historical document. Starting as a raucous celluloid freak-out, the film presents its square’s-eye view of the “Generation Gap” through the fictive device of a round table of pod people, each alike in their helmet-hair and cat’s eye glasses. The production crew of this film was primarily made up of teenagers and young adults. Music by ‘The Stayns.’ A minor masterpiece of psychedelic cinema.
results.title_for_label: Beyond LSD: a film for concerned adults and teenagers
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Burnford, Film Associates and Paul Burnford Film Productions

results.title: Begone dull care
results.creator_credit: Norman McLaren, Evelyn Lambart and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A lively interpretation of jazz music played by the Oscar Peterson Trio. The music is visually represented in a series of abstract lines and shapes, hand painted directly on to the film, culminating in a fast and furious explosion as the tempo quickens. One of the high points of jazz in cinema (and of McLaren’s career).

results.title: Roland Robinson
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Writers Talking”.
A poet with a strong attachment to the Australian landscape, Roland Robinson has a deep interest in Aboriginal lore, and performs his poetry with a memorable verve.

results.title: A Changing culture
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Rainbow serpent”.
David Gulpilil has become a success in the white man’s world, through his acting ability and leadership of a dance troupe. Yet he prefers to live in a traditional manner with his people in Arnhem Land, making brief forays into western society in order to publicise their plight and demonstrate the richness of their culture. Charmaine Green is a linguist student at the Australian National University. When she visits her family in Mullewa, W.A. and observes the hopeless life they lead on the fringes of western society, she feels that she cannot return there permanently, although she is determined not to deny her Aboriginality in spite of her light skin.

results.title: A Shame Like Alice. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Leonard Lee, Lee Gordon Productions and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus”.

In March 1983 Focus spent one week in the Northern Territory looking at the living conditions of First Nations people in the most famous small town in Australia, Alice Springs. Includes interviews with Neville Bonner and Al Grassby.

results.title: The Consequences of nuclear war
results.creator_credit: Ross Christopher and Australian National University
results.brief_description: Highlights of a conference, with the same name as the title, which was held at the Australian National University. The papers dealt with various aspects of the nuclear arms race and were presented by a range of Australian and international speakers.

results.title: Compilation Ultimate skills
results.brief_description: Ultimate skills (Australia): Three motorcycle champions explain and demonstrate their skills at trail riding, motocross and road riding. 2.” Survival of the fastest” (U.K.): Shows the evolution of the motorcycle from a primitive machine into a glamorous, sophisticated piece of engineering. Looks at research and development and compares British and Japanese bikes.

results.title: The Sydney Opera House Tenth Anniversary Recital: Roger Woodward
results.creator_credit: Peter Skillman, Peter Abbott and Yoho Productions
results.brief_description: Roper Woodward played the first recital at the Sydney Opera House in 1973 and ten years later he was given the honour of performing the tenth anniversary recital on October 1, 1983. This video presents Roger Woodward performing the commemorative tenth recital live at the Sydney Opera House playing three of Beethoven’s sonatas and ending with an encore of Chopin’s Grand Waltz.

results.title: Compilation The Angel and the rat
results.brief_description: The Angel and the rat (Melbourne, dir. Steve McDonald): Examines the ideas and lifestyle of Smiley Williams, a young sculptor. “Heart, head and hand” (dir. Peter Weir): Scenes from the life and work of Australian potter, Peter Rushforth. “Natural glass” (N.Z. dir. John King ; prod. Derek Wright); Looks at a one-man revival of natural glassmaking in New Zealand.
